name: And Operator
content:
More complex decisions sometimes require two things to be true. The *&&* operator allows you to check if both operand expressions are true, and then possibly perform some specific action using an *if*, *if-else*, or *while* block. 
// Truth table for the boolean AND operator.
console.log(true && true);
console.log(true && false);
console.log(false && true);
console.log(false && false);

examples.name: Working 9 to 5
examples.description: Determines if it is currently working hours.

examples.name: Take Your Temperature
examples.description: Check whether a given temperature is in a healthy range or not.

palette_params.name: expression1
palette_params.description: The first boolean expression to evaluate.

palette_params.name: expression2
palette_params.description: The second boolean expression to evaluate.

short_description: More complex decisions sometimes require two things to be true. The && operator allows you to check if both operand expressions are true, and then possibly perform some specific action using an if, if-else, or while block.
tips: * Some complex decisions using an && operator can sometimes be rewritten to use an || operator. It is fine to choose whichever reads clearest.
